intro: Pleiarina plectilis, commonly known as the narrow-leaf pleiarina, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
